text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Amstrad Color Personal Computer (CPC) is an 8-bit PC released in 1984. It uses a CPU based on the Zilog Z80A clocked at 4MHz, having between 64 to 128KB of RAM depending on which model was bought. Models released include the CPC464, CPC664, CPC6128, 464plus and the 6128plus. It could display a resolution of 192x272 in 16 colors, 354x272 in 4 and 768x272 in 2. Games could utilize all three modes at the same time. Designed for the family market, its installation was made to be as simple as possible.
